clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Fingolimod in the Treatment of New Coronavirus Pneumonia (COVID-19)

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Although immune-inflammatory treatment is not routinely recommended to be used for SARS-CoV-2 pneumonia, according to the pathological findings of pulmonary oedema and hyaline membrane formation, timely and appropriate use of immune modulator together with ventilator support should be considered for the severe patients to prevent ARDS development. The sphingosine-1-phosphate receptor regulators Fingolimod (FTY720) is an effective immunology modulator which has been widely used in multiple sclerosis.The aim of this study was to determine whether the efficacy of fingolimod for a novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

primary_outcome.measure: The change of pneumonia severity on X-ray images
primary_outcome.description: The lesion change on X-ray images from day 5 to baseline

intervention.description: Each patient in the fingolimod treatment group was given 0.5 mg of fingolimod orally once daily, for three consecutive days

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University
